text: Thank You sandy and good afternoon my
name is Ian ray and I lead the
infrastructure and operations
organization for Pearson school and
clinical assessment we've been a
customer of AWS now for about seven
years we started off as most did with a
very instant centric approach using a
lot of homegrown tooling so we used
customized home built an she ation
engines to describe the infrastructure
very heavy chef in fact a lot of our
DevOps engineers spent their days with
their heads buried in chef cookbooks
something I'm sure they look back fondly
on and over the last three years we've
been moving to more of a mutable
infrastructure so utilizing terraform
docker ECS ansible we're a heavy user of
RDS in particular Aurora
RDS Aurora and today though we're going
to talk a little bit about a product
that came to us about two years ago two
or three years ago called Schoolnet some
of you may have heard a Schoolnet it is
a classroom assessment product it
combines classroom assessment with
instructional management as well as
reporting it's used by about a hundred
and ninety different customers different
states and districts in the US and then
we have some international customers
some large usage out in India and other
areas Schoolnet was built on a Microsoft
stack and so this was the first
Microsoft stack my teams had actually
seen a big stack and it was hosted in a
traditional datacenter in fact too we
had a production data center and a
second datacenter for disaster recovery
a big waste of infrastructure sit in
there waiting for something to fail from
the production data center and so a lot
of overhead a lot of complexity with the
operational side as well so we formed an
SRE team specifically focused around
Schoolnet and decided to start the AWS
journey and trying to line Schoolnet
with us
an operating model and get it migrated
into AWS we started that journey by
initially migrating the disaster
recovery target to AWS and we actually
asked two of our big stake customers to
run a live dr test with us they did that
and it's actually part of the the
contract we have with these states and
they didn't want to go back they asked
if they could stay on the Amazon
infrastructure and not go back to the
day I said we weren't quite ready and so
we had to disappoint them and have them
continue using the data center
infrastructure until we were ready to go
production in AWS so this year we went
live with Schoolnet in AWS or SRE team a
big big hats off to John winner Michael
who have worked numerous hours this year
to migrate that application out into AWS
and the customers are ecstatic just to
give you an idea of the the volumes were
talking about with just Schoolnet we
service millions of students across the
US and globally millions upon millions
of online tests generated each year and
tens of thousands of educators are
served by this product the teachers also
have the ability to create their own
tests within their classroom so they can
send out a quick Quizlet to their
students get instant results from the
students within the classroom and we saw
a 55 to 70 percent reduction in those
processing times for these tests as we
migrate Schoolnet to AWS blazing
response times is that's not my word
that was the feedback we received to the
cut from each and every customer that
came over as we were there each customer
went live we just received a tremendous
amount of feedback about how fast you
know this product is twenty years old it
was developed in the late 90s and it's
running like a brand-new Ferrari I think
was actually one of the quotes we go so
what else did we see few things that we
we did a lot on the way here so we were
able to implement automated deployments
reduce our infrastructure cost that was
a big one and so a lot of people ask me
well you know Microsoft's very expensive
to host in in AWS not the case here we
were actually able to reduce our costs
by about 30 percent from what we were
paying on there on the datacenter side
cost and licensing I'll talk to in just
a minute high availability so rather
than have that traditional dr type of
approach we have got active active
across the AZ's and the east coast so
the east region and we also have cross
site replication for any regional type
failures all made automotive passion in
compliance something else we were able
to to get in there automated
configuration management improve
scalability and stability we have had
and I need to find some wood to knock on
somewhere plastic
100% uptime since we went live in AWS I
hope I didn't just drink something there
but it the uptime has been phenomenal
and the customers have most definitely
appreciated that as well stock two
audits
big one for us so we have to satisfy
stock to audit compliance across all of
the different assessment products that
we support and doing that in a
traditional data center anyone that's
done that and had to go through that
entire process certifying all of your
physical controls the facility side and
everything else it's an absolute
nightmare
having Amazon in that shared
responsibility type model take care of
all the physical components and just
focusing on the hosting and the controls
and so forth around that has made that
far far easier and in facts
Schoolnet is currently going through its
its first sock to audit multiple regions
we do have Schoolnet deployed across
three different regions and so we do as
I mentioned service India with Schoolnet
we also have customers going live in
Brazil and South Africa and on to the
last slide oh no that's that's wonderful
laughs so
twice as fast from the response
perspective there's the red Ferrari and
30% on the cost-saving side license
management so when we came to the end of
the migration that picture actually
resonated with me because our corporate
folks came to us and said well what are
you doing about licenses compliance we
got a crew up coming up and not just on
the Microsoft site but also on the
Oracle side and so I turned to our AWS
exec account rep Eric Phelan who's been
awesome throughout this migration
working with our teams and asked him I
said you guys have anything we can we
can use for for license compliance for
tracking and finding out what we have in
our estate he said well it just so
happens we have this new product coming
out and would you like a private preview
of it well sure yeah well what I could
private preview and so we did and it
couldn't be any easier to use they
plugged it into our the account we asked
them to plug it into and it was
literally plug and play and we were able
to see license consumption very very
intuitive not to mention the fact that
we were able to also use that on the
Oracle side so we were looking at a lot
of the Oracle licensing as we have
another trip coming with Oracle next

seen so far and looking forward to get
